description: A news release from the Arkansas Rural Health Partnership (ARHP) announces a five‑year, $2 million grant from SAMHSA to expand peer recovery support services in collaboration with adult treatment drug courts.  The grant provides training and resources, offers job assistance, housing and transportation support, reduces stigma and builds support groups.  Judges note that peer recovery specialists bring valuable lived experience and the grant will sustain and expand peer support in court settings.
source: Arkansas Rural Health Partnership news release (Nov 18 2024)
quote: The Arkansas Rural Health Partnership's new five‑year, $2M project ... offers training and resources ... providing transportation for healthcare appointments and advocating for better local infrastructure ... Peer Recovery Specialists bring invaluable lived experience and understanding to the courtroom ... this five-year grant is a significant step towards establishing a sustainable and impactful program 【165071006859232†L47-L90】
